Cells¶

The cell module¶

class biosim.Cell.Cell(population)[source]¶

Class for cells

counting_animals()[source]¶

A function for counting how many animals there are in the cell. We also need to differentiate between the different animals and provide two variables for this

dead_animals_natural_cause()[source]¶

Each year some animals will die of natural causes. We check if the animal dies or not by using the function death_probability. After we need to remove them from the from the list of animals

feed_carnivores()[source]¶

  1. sorts herbivores and carnivores by fitness

  2. makes the carnivores eat

  3. makes the carnivores gain weight

  4. remove all eaten herbivores

make_animals_age()[source]¶

Each year the animals ages. Here we use the aging function from the herbivore class

make_animals_lose_weight()[source]¶

Each year the animal loses weight based on their own weight and eta

make_herbivores_eat()[source]¶

The animals eats available fodder until their appetite is filled. The eat_fodder-function from the Herbivore class does this. Herbivores eat in a random order, and therefore need to be randomised

move_animals_from_cell()[source]¶

Checks if the animal has moved previously and also if move_single_animal() = True If it is it is added to herbs/carns_move and removed from the herbivores/carnivores_pop Later already_moved is changed to True

Returns

tot_animals, list with a list of the moving herbivores and a list of the moving

carnivores :rtype: list

move_animals_to_cell(list_of_moving_animals)[source]¶

Adds the migrating animals into a new cell

Parameters

list_of_moving_animals – list with a list of the moving herbivores and a list of the

moving carnivores :type list_of_moving_animals: list

newborn_animals()[source]¶

An animal gives birth maximum once per year.The function birth_probability calculates if the animal will give birth or not and birth_weight_loss calculates the new weight for the mother. The newborn must be added to the list of either herbivores or carnivores

reset_already_moved()[source]¶

After all the animals in all the cells have moved, they will reset so that they can move again next year

classmethod set_given_parameters(params)[source]¶

Saves the parameters for the different cells for use in Cell class

sorting_animals()[source]¶

A function for sorting the animals. Herbivores are sorted weakest to fittest, since the weakest are eaten first Carnivores are sorted fittest to weakest, since the fittest eats first

class biosim.Cell.Desert(population)[source]¶

subclass for highland class

Initialises desert class

Parameters

population (list) – list of dictionaries containing animals
